DOC.brief_summary: The aim of the study was to evaluate visual outcomes, contrast sensitivity, glare testing and high order aberrations induced by different laser technologies and to evaluate differences in aberrometer technology. We hypothesized that there will not be differences among conventional or wavefront guided treatments.
DOC.brief_title: Evaluation of Visual Outcomes After Myopic LASIK
DOC.detailed_description: The aim of the study was to evaluate and compare visual outcomes, contrast sensitivity, glare testing and induction of high order aberrations by different laser technologies and to evaluate differences in aberrometer technology.
DOC.criteria: 18 years or older Candidates for bilateral LASIK Myopic range: 0.00 to 7.00 D Astigmatism: 0.00 to 5.00 D Pupil size greater than 8mm diameter, infrared measurement thin corneas (preoperatively calculated minimal residual bed < 250 um) irregular astigmatism asymmetric astigmatism unstable refraction other criteria that preclude the patient to undergo LASIK
